page.title: 01Baldersdale
page.content: A tributary valley of Teesdale. Baldersdale is characterised largely by its reservoirs which have a total area of 700 acres. The largest of these, Balderhead reservoir, lies 1100 feet above sea level. Although built to supply water to Teesdale and Darlington, the reservoirs also have recreational use, for water skiing and fishing. On either side of the reservoirs is a patchwork of fields used for grazind and rearing of cattle and sheep. There are many stone walls and scattered farmsteads, often sheltered by clumps of deciduous trees. A very minor road along each side of the valley gives access to the farms and the reservoirs.
